content: US To Boycott UN Conference On Racism "WASHINGTON — The Obama administration will boycott "with regret" a U.N. conference on racism next week over objectionable language in the meeting's final document that could single out Israel for criticism and restrict free speech, the State Department said Saturday." "http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/04/18/us-to-boycott-un-conferen_n_188602.html" Hey Jack...another Obama myth debunked?
reply: US To Boycott UN Conference On Racism "WASHINGTON — The Obama administration will boycott "with regret" a U.N. conference on racism next week over objectionable language in the meeting's final document that could single out Israel for criticism and restrict free speech, the State Department said Saturday." title: Obama Backs Free Speech and Israel - UN Conf Boycott

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: US To Boycott UN Conference On Racism "WASHINGTON — The Obama administration will boycott "with regret" a U.N. conference on racism next week over objectionable language in the meeting's final document that could single out Israel for criticism and restrict free speech, the State Department said Saturday." "http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/04/18/us-to-boycott-un-conferen_n_188602.html" Hey Jack...another Obama myth debunked? If the conference is next week, how can the final document be ready yet? I dunno Popsig? Would it hurt to read the link before commenting? quote: The administration had wanted to attend the April 20-25 meeting in Geneva, although it warned in late February it would not go unless significant changes were made to the draft text. Some revisions _ including the removal of specific critical references to Israel and problematic passages about the defamation of religion _ were negotiated for which State Department spokesman Robert Wood said the administration was "deeply grateful." But he said the text retains troubling elements that suggest support for restrictions on free speech and an affirmation of the findings of the first World Conference Against Racism, held in Durban, South Africa, in 2001 that the U.S cannot endorse. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: US To Boycott UN Conference On Racism "WASHINGTON — The Obama administration will boycott "with regret" a U.N. conference on racism next week over objectionable language in the meeting's final document that could single out Israel for criticism and restrict free speech, the State Department said Saturday." "http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/04/18/us-to-boycott-un-conferen_n_188602.html" Hey Jack...another Obama myth debunked? If the conference is next week, how can the final document be ready yet? I dunno Popsig? Would it hurt to read the link before commenting? quote: The administration had wanted to attend the April 20-25 meeting in Geneva, although it warned in late February it would not go unless significant changes were made to the draft text. Some revisions _ including the removal of specific critical references to Israel and problematic passages about the defamation of religion _ were negotiated for which State Department spokesman Robert Wood said the administration was "deeply grateful." But he said the text retains troubling elements that suggest support for restrictions on free speech and an affirmation of the findings of the first World Conference Against Racism, held in Durban, South Africa, in 2001 that the U.S cannot endorse. Dave Sixteen pages of recommendations, recognitions, exhortations and approvals - the bafflegab that only a middle manager could love. The 'pre-approved' final report of conference that hadn't happened. They could have skipped the subsequent fiasco and voted by phone. Just how did Achmedinejad get elected lead-off speaker? Did he promise to 'be good'? Or did he win some kind of lucky draw? Where's the 'free' speech, if you can't call somebody a killer, and somebody else anti-semitic? Oh, it's the subjective brand of 'free'.

Would it hurt to read the link before commenting? quote: The administration had wanted to attend the April 20-25 meeting in Geneva, although it warned in late February it would not go unless significant changes were made to the draft text. Some revisions _ including the removal of specific critical references to Israel and problematic passages about the defamation of religion _ were negotiated for which State Department spokesman Robert Wood said the administration was "deeply grateful." But he said the text retains troubling elements that suggest support for restrictions on free speech and an affirmation of the findings of the first World Conference Against Racism, held in Durban, South Africa, in 2001 that the U.S cannot endorse. The 'pre-approved' final report of conference that hadn't happened. They could have skipped the subsequent fiasco and voted by phone. Just how did Achmedinejad get elected lead-off speaker? Did he promise to 'be good'? Or did he win some kind of lucky draw? Where's the 'free' speech, if you can't call somebody a killer, and somebody else anti-semitic? Oh, it's the subjective brand of 'free'. Nice rant... But the US didn't attend, since the free speech part of the routine was defacto annuled with the writing of the final document well in advance. Might as well attend a conference on Racism hosted by the KKK, where the conclusions are drawn up by the Aryan Nations in advance. Dave
